perturbation.original_text: Payment of License Fees shall be made in Canadian funds in arrears within thirty (30) days following each calendar month during the Term in which Licensed Programs were exhibited hereunder and shall be accompanied by a statement of account showing the calculation of the License Fees.
perturbation.changed_text: Payment of License Fees shall be made in Canadian funds in arrears within sixty (60) days following each calendar month during the Term in which Licensed Programs were exhibited hereunder and shall be accompanied by a statement of account showing the calculation of the License Fees.
perturbation.explanation: This change introduces a contradiction by altering the payment deadline from thirty (30) days to sixty (60) days in Section 6(c). This conflicts with the original thirty (30) day deadline, creating uncertainty about when payments are actually due, potentially leading to disputes. A different section could implicitly reference the thirty (30) day period, making this perturbation more apparent.

perturbation.original_text: Notwithstanding any other provision of this Agreement, Rogers may terminate this Agreement, at any time, upon sixty (60) days' prior written notice to Licensor.
perturbation.changed_text: Notwithstanding any other provision of this Agreement, Rogers may terminate this Agreement, at any time, upon thirty (30) days' prior written notice to Licensor.
perturbation.explanation: This modification reduces the notice period required for termination by Rogers from sixty (60) days to thirty (30) days. This directly contradicts the original clause. If another section refers back to the original sixty (60) day period, it creates conflict and ambiguity regarding the actual required notice period, which can lead to disputes over the legitimacy of a termination notice.

perturbation.original_text: If either party terminates this Agreement prior to its expiration, Rogers shall be entitled to continue to distribute and exhibit all Licensed Programs then being distributed and exhibited on the ROD Service, in each case, for a period of sixty (60) days from the effective date of termination or the expiry of the relevant License Period, whichever is earlier, and, in such event, Rogers shall continue to be bound by its payment obligations set forth herein in respect of such Licensed Programs.
perturbation.changed_text: If either party terminates this Agreement prior to its expiration, Rogers shall be entitled to continue to distribute and exhibit all Licensed Programs then being distributed and exhibited on the ROD Service, in each case, for a period of thirty (30) days from the effective date of termination or the expiry of the relevant License Period, whichever is earlier, and, in such event, Rogers shall continue to be bound by its payment obligations set forth herein in respect of such Licensed Programs.
perturbation.explanation: The modified text changes the post-termination distribution period from sixty (60) days to thirty (30) days. This in-text contradiction creates ambiguity about the extent to which Rogers can continue to use Licensed Programs after termination, leading to potential disputes regarding usage rights and payment obligations during this period.
